alert.note: Alert for Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 1115 PM MST... At 1030 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New River, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek, Lake Pleasant, Horseshoe Reservoir, Anthem, and Seven Springs. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 218 and 241. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 25 and 30. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 134 and 139. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River
